thread.title: Retailers Taking Applications For Seasonal Jobs
thread.title_full: Retailers Taking Applications For Seasonal Jobs

title: Retailers Taking Applications For Seasonal Jobs
text:
Retailers Taking Applications For Seasonal Jobs October 12, 2015, 7:05 AM by Brittany Larson SIOUX FALLS, SD - 
We're more than a month away from Black Friday, but Peggy Van Alyne and other team members at Target are already preparing for the holiday season. 
"We're just starting to ramp up for the holiday season and we already opened up some of our positions and we're hiring about 40 plus positions here for the season," Van Alyne said. "So it's a fun and it will be a good year and it's going to go fast it always does." 
At the main entrance, now hiring signs are visibly marked for all guests who are interested in seasonal work. 
"We are doing on-the-spot interviews and we have computers here to fill out the applications, and we have paper applications also," Van Alyne said. 
The right fit has a lot to do with having a friendly personality. 
"Just being energetic and positive and getting the guests what they need and getting it in a timely manner for them," Van Alyne said. 
Gregory Johnson, manager for South Dakota Department of Labor and Regulations, said more than 700 people in Sioux Falls will be hired during the holiday season. 
"Sioux Falls, as of August, has an unemployment rate estimate of 2.5 percent. And that matches last year," Johnson said. 
Johnson says if you already have a full-time job, but are still looking for extra work, make sure you are up front about your availability. 
"A lot of the seasonal businesses, retailers, and others, they need you for many hours during the holiday season," Johnson said. "So be firm in your mind about what you want to get out of this season employment opportunity." 
And it's an opportunity that can lead to something more long term. 
"Some of them can become permanent positions. We do have a limited number of positions, but we do also keep some on," Van Alyne said. Â© 2015 KELOLAND TV. All Rights Reserved.
